body:
For some backends, rclone knows how long the maximum file length is, or at least you can work it out fairly easily, so maybe rclone should error **before** uploading the file.

I've shied away from doing that in the past because I haven't wanted to tie rclone to unpublished provider details, but for a provider like dropbox it is published and rclone could do that.

That would fix the multiple upload problem. However it would still leave errors in your sync

Looking at your log, if rclone made the first error `error path/malformed_path/...` a non retriable error then that would fix the problem too - that might be the simplest fix.

I'm not sure where the subsequent `lookup_failed/incorrect_offset/...` errors come from though.

@ncw Is there any logging I can get you to help with the subsequent errors?

I think rclone erroring before uploading the file would make sense for my workflow but I understand why you would shy away from implementing limits.

I've done some more testing now with the following command

`rclone -vv --progress --retries 1 copy`

Which is supposed to skip retries according to the docs but it still seems to attempt multiple uploads of the file? Should  I raise that as a seperate bug?

issue.title: Skip long titled folder? --max-name-length

milestone.title: Soon
milestone.description: Issues which are a good idea but haven't been assigned a specific release yet.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
```
Received error: failed to make directory: HTTP code 400: "400 Bad Request", reponse body: {"message":"1 validation error detected: Value 'BLABLAlooooNG.....ENCRYPTED' at 'name' failed to satisfy constraint: Member must have length less than or equal to 280"}
 - low level retry 1/10
```

is there a ways to skip that?

body:
> Which is supposed to skip retries according to the docs but it still seems to attempt multiple uploads of the file? Should I raise that as a seperate bug?

You are getting `--low-level-retries` here, so set that flag lower `--low-level-retries 1`

However I've had a go at a proper fix - can you try this please?

[v1.54.0-beta.4922.d472f0cd4.fix-4805-dropbox](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-4805-dropbox/v1.54.0-beta.4922.d472f0cd4.fix-4805-dropbox/) on branch [fix-4805-dropbox](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-4805-dropbox) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

It should fail and not retry the malformed_path error.

@ncw Thanks for your efforts. Looks promising but now we enter a different error state. The same command now produces this

2020-11-26 13:54:31 DEBUG : pacer: low level retry 1/10 (error path/malformed_path/...)
2020-11-26 13:54:31 DEBUG : pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 20ms

2020-11-26 13:54:38 DEBUG : pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 2s
2020-11-26 13:54:38 DEBUG : pacer: Reducing sleep to 1.5s
2020-11-26 13:54:39 DEBUG : pacer: low level retry 9/10 (error lookup_failed/incorrect_offset/.)
2020-11-26 13:54:39 DEBUG : pacer: Rate limited, increasing sleep to 2s

And the file restarts uploading.

edit: Sorry, I've just realised that is the same error as before so apologies for the false information to you there. Still seems to occur on the build you've sent

So interestingly, if I tell rclone to specifically copy the directory that is far too long for dropbox, we immediately bomb out as expected

./rclone -vv --progress copy "gdrivecryptnocache:media/Kids Tv/Animaniacs/Season 3/Animaniacs - 3x38-39-40-41-42-43 - Wakko's 2-note Song + Panama Canal + Hello Nurse + The Ballad of Magellan + The Return of the Great Wakkorotti + The Big Wrap Party Tonight/" "dropboxcrypt:media/Kids Tv/Animaniacs/Season 3/Animaniacs - 3x38-39-40-41-42-43 - Wakko's 2-note Song + Panama Canal + Hello Nurse + The Ballad of Magellan + The Return of the Great Wakkorotti + The Big Wrap Party Tonight/"

I see what is happening. In multipart uploads for dropbox you upload the data first, then you give the file name.

Try this

[v1.54.0-beta.4926.b773199c9.fix-4805-dropbox](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-4805-dropbox/v1.54.0-beta.4926.b773199c9.fix-4805-dropbox/) on branch [fix-4805-dropbox](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-4805-dropbox) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Sadly a similar effect, I assume from reading this log that the error would end up being retired 10 times before bombing out?
